title: Understanding Research Objectives
text: Think about what you want to achieve with your research. What are the main goals or outcomes you are aiming for?

title: Differentiating Objectives and Questions
text: Consider how a research objective might guide the direction of your study, while a research question might focus on specific inquiries within that direction.

title: Focus on Goals
text: A research objective often outlines the purpose or aim of the study. How does this differ from simply asking a question?

hintAnswer: A research objective is more focused than a research question
title: Identifying the Core Difference
text: Reflect on how objectives are broader and more goal-oriented compared to questions, which are more specific and inquiry-based.
choices: There can only be one research objective
A research objective is more focused than a research question
A research objective can only relate to a hypothesis
The research objective is concerned with the goals of your research rather than the questions your data collection attempts to answer
